non_residential_details.development_type: Change of Use with Extension(s) over 999sqm

description: Demolition of vacant first floor cafe building and removal of planters, walkways and 2 disabled car parking spaces and erection of first floor retail unit (933 sq.metres gross internal floorspace) with roof top plant linked to vacant ground floor unit (unit 14A) to create a 1394 sq.metre retail unit and alteration of 3 car parking spaces to 2 disabled spaces on level 2
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Prior to occupation of the retail unit hereby permitted a secure cycle cage with spaces for 6 cycles shall be provided in general accordance with the details shown on Colman Architects drawing 2456/P(-)11.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Prior to occupation of the development details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation. Reason:	In the interests of the living and working conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and SPG 10 Noise and Vibration | The development shall comply with the aims and objectives of the requirements of 'Secured By Design'. Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by the Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime' and with requirements of clause 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1988 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area' in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.4 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance note 8 'Safer Ealing' | The layout and design of the building should make provision for the requirements of disabled persons in accordance with the provisions of Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing' Reason: In the interests of disabled persons and in pursuance of policy 4.3 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The relocation of the disabled parking spaces hereby approved shall be marked out in accordance with plan no. 2456/P--10 prior to commencement of the development.  Reason: To ensure there is sufficient disabled parking spaces within the shopping centre in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.7 of the London Borough of Ealing Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the submitted plans the brickwork shall be 'Ibstock: Leicester Orange', the metal composite panels cladding panels shall be 'Kingspan KS900/1000 colour: Citrine', the framing to the shop front windows and coping flashing to Town Square fatade shall be dark grey aluminium, the external door shall be gloss painted 'reef green' and the roofing shall be aluminium 'Rigidal Ziplock' unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and in accordance with the policy 4.1 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | The colour of the render panels shown on application drawings 204 and 205 shall be confirmed and agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority prior to installation'.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and in accordance with the policies 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'New Plan for the Environment 2004'.
